Learn math, science, art, history & more. 📚💻
Follow for study tips, inspiration & giveaways! ✨

node.text:
Jason spent 15 years in prison. While there, he educated himself with books from the prison library. He started learning math from transcripts of Khan Academy videos.

Jason was released early and enrolled in community college. He now studies computer science at Stanford.

#YouCanLearnAnything #GrowthMindset #KhanAcademy #LearningNeverStops

node.text:
Explain how we elect US presidents with the electoral college in under 4 minutes... But to a @sesamestreet character. ✔️ Sounds like a job for Sal Khan.

How many chicken votes 🐔 (electoral college votes) does your state have? 👀

#elections #electionday #election2020 #vote #vote2020 #civics

node.title: Sal teaches Grover about the electoral college

node.text:
Public opinion polls can only tell us so much about the outcome of elections and public policy. In Khan Academy's AP US Government & Politics course, Sal goes over the reasons why election results may end up being different than what polls indicate. 🗳️

#khanacademy #apgov #vote2020 #election2020 #voting #electionday #elections

node.title: How much do opinion polls tell us?

node.text:
Public statements are a bare minimum and only version 1.0 of a reckoning, says Bill Lewis, former @naacp Legal Defense Fund co-chair. Watch on IGTV to learn what additional legal and cultural reforms he believes are necessary for racial equality.

Catch the full interview with Sal and Bill Lewis ➡️ Link in bio.

node.title: A path to ending systemic racism from Bill Lewis

node.text:
Sal answers questions from #Classof2020 graduating students.🧑🏻‍🎓👩🏾‍🎓
.
What was Sal’s graduation day like? How to pick a major? How to learn from failure? What would Sal have done differently in college? 🧐
.
Tune in live for Daily Homeroom with Sal and special guests every weekday at noon PT!
.
#graduation #graduation2020 #khanacademy #seniors2020 #grad2020

node.text:
Enter for a chance to win a $250,000 scholarship! 🤑 Looking for something fun to do while learning at home? 👀 Students ages 13-18 can participate by creating a short video explaining a challenging concept in physics, math, or the life sciences in an engaging, illuminating, and creative way. 🚀 (Basically, consider this your try-out to be the next Sal Khan! 😆)
.

node.text:
What was the first book you remember reading just for fun?

Maybe it's a book you picked out at the library.📚 Or something a teacher assigned that you fell in love with.🍎 Or maybe someone gave it to you as a gift.🎁

We love reading and hope you do, too. Exploring new worlds🌏, rooting for flawed but lovable characters🎉, sobbing at sad endings😭, being challenged to think about something differently🤔 - what's not to love?💖📚💖 Happy #LiteracyDay!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Khan Academy on September 06, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Friends don't let friends have a fixed mindset. PART 3 person."()」 person. L(ツ)_/ I'm just not a math No one is born knowing math. will help you study!'.

node.text:
Raise your hand if you've ever said you're not a math person.🙃

Stelly is here to remind us that there is no such thing as a math person (or a "science person," or a "writing person," etc.)! Our brains can always change and grow if we give them the right kind of practice.🧠

Don't believe us? Name a skill that you know now and can do smoothly that you couldn't do when you were born.🐣 We bet you can think of quite a few examples (walking, talking, getting dressed, etc.).🚶🗣️👟

The growth mindset is the belief that you can grow your brain and that your intelligence grows with effort.💪 A fixed mindset is the belief that you are born a certain way and cannot change.❌

It’s normal to have both a fixed mindset and a growth mindset competing for our attention.😵 Next time you don't get the grade you wanted on an exam or quiz, you can try to use your words and actions to challenge the fixed mindset voice so that you can adopt a growth mindset.😤😤😤

Your words:
1️⃣ The power of yet: Add yet at the end of your fixed mindset statements. Example: “I can’t do this.” → “I can’t do this YET!”
2️⃣ Say stop: When your fixed mindset voice is getting out of hand, tell yourself to stop and clear your mind before continuing.

Your actions:
1️⃣ Ask for help. Let your teacher know that you are struggling so that they can put you back on the right path.
2️⃣ Make a study group. Talk and work together with different study strategies.
3️⃣ Revisit your mistakes. Look at your mistakes, and review what you did wrong. This will help you avoid making the same mistake again later.

✨Share this post with a friend and let us know how you've challenged a fixed mindset in the comments. ⬇️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Khan Academy on August 29, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Friends don't let friends have a fixed mindset. PART I got another question wrong. wrong.UGH.Always UGH. Always failing. Mistakes aren't failures. They are learning opportunities. You got this.'.

node.text:
Don't know who needs to hear this but mistakes are not failures.💖

Stelly is back helping out their friend Cacteye who keeps making mistakes. As you start a new school year, you might be making some mistakes too. What do you do when you make a mistake?

First - figure out what type of mistake you made. Here are three types of mistakes and some strategies for transforming them into opportunities to grow your brain.

1️⃣ Slow-down opportunity 🐢
What is it? A slow-down opportunity is an accident or a silly mistake. It may be caused by rushing your work. It's something you can fix on your own.
What can you do? Slow down a bit, check your work a second time, and take a short break.

2️⃣ Review opportunity 🧐
What is it? A review opportunity is a medium-size mistake, something you don’t quite understand yet. But, you know where to look for better understanding.
What can you do? There are major learning gains to be made by reviewing and reflecting on a concept you missed or misunderstood. Take some time to review, or reread the chapter. Reflect on your mistake until you feel like you have mastered it and won't get tripped up again in the future.

3️⃣ Feedback opportunity 🙋
What is it? A feedback opportunity is a bigger mistake. You can’t figure it out on your own, even when you review.
What can you do? Raise your hand to ask your teacher, text a friend, go to tutoring, or ask someone to help you! 

What are some mistakes you have made in the last few weeks? Categorize them into slow-down opportunities, review opportunities, and feedback opportunities. What should you do next time you make a mistake?

#LearnStorm #GrowthMindset #Mistakes #StudyTips #HighSchool #MiddleSchool #BackToSchool

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Khan Academy on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'POP QUIZ! Which one of these is false? A. 250,000 people attended the March on Washington B. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. did not initiate the rally c. The sole purpose was to eliminate Jim Crow laws'.

node.text:
Pop quiz! Which of these is false?🤔

Fifty eight years ago on August 28, 1963, one of the largest civil rights rallies in US history, and one of the most famous examples of non-violent mass direct action took place in Washington, D.C.✊🏿✊🏽✊✊🏾

How much do you know about this important event? Which of these is false? 
A. 250,000 people attended the March on Washington
B. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. did not initiate the rally
C. The sole purpose was to eliminate Jim Crow laws

UPDATE: The answer is C. The sole purpose of the #MarchOnWashington was not to eliminate Jim Crow laws, though the protestors desired to bring a swift end to it. The majority of the demands revolved around economic justice – equal access to public facilities and accommodations, housing, education, and jobs.

Comment with your guess and check back tomorrow for the answer.⬇️

You can also find the answer (and learn a lot more about the Civil Rights Movement) at the link in our bio.🔗

node.text:
If you could go back in time, what grade would you retake?🔁

😬 Maybe you wish you had paid more attention...

Whatever your reason, we want to know about it! ⬇️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Khan Academy on August 22, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Friends don't let friends have a fixed mindset. PART smh this is too hard! |quit! Eggs you're frustrated, but your brain is growing. Keep going!'.

node.text:
New school year, new mindset. Let's grow!🌱

Do you ever hear your friends (or yourself!) saying things like:
😖 This is too hard!
🤧 I'm going to quit.
😫 I can't do this.

When learning something new, it can be frustrating getting things wrong. Frustration is a normal part of life. How you respond to it, though, can make all the difference. 

Be a good friend like Stelly and try these three things when your friends (or you!) are frustrated:

Step 1: Recognize your frustration. Don't ignore it. Allowing yourself to be frustrated and saying to yourself that it is okay is an important first step and is surprisingly relieving.😌

Step 2: Remind. Sometimes struggle and a little frustration are a good thing. It means you’re challenging yourself to learn. Remind yourself that difficulty—and struggle—are a natural part of pushing yourself to grow as a learner.💪

Step 3: Reset. Try taking a short break. A few minutes away might be what your brain needs. Then, come back to your work. Often, you will see the problem with fresh eyes.🧘‍♀️

Practice these steps this week and keep going! Keep growing! 🙌 Want to learn more about why frustration is a natural part of learning? Check out the link in our bio.🔗

Our avatars will be here again next week for part 2 of #GrowthMindset tips. ⭐🥚

#LearnStorm #Motivation #StudyInspo #StudyTips #HighSchool #MiddleSchool #BackToSchool

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Khan Academy on August 19, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'BUCKS * " I try to focus in the moment, in the present. That's humility. That's being humble. GIANNIS ANTETOKOUNMPO MILWAUKEE BUCKS'.

node.text:
Win the NBA Championship.✔️ Inspire everyone with your quote.😭

Here's a little throwback from July, when the Milwaukee @Bucks won the NBA Finals. Giannis Antetokounmpo was asked in an interview after the NBA Finals Game 4 how he stays so grounded. We love his response. 💖

🌟"When you focus on the past, that's your ego. 'I beat this team. I did that in the past.' 
When you focus on the future, that's your pride. 'Next game I'm going to do this and this.' 
I try to focus in the moment, in the present. That's humility. That's being humble.”🌟

As you start a new school year, be like Giannis - focus on the moment and being present. Don't get caught up in what happened in the past or get worried about the future.✨

Watch the video of his interview at the link in our bio.🔗

📷 Photo of @giannis_an34 by Keith Allison.

#tbt #motivation #BallIsLife #NBAPlayoffs #Bucks #MilwaukeeBucks #FearTheDeer

How much do you know about Khan Academy? 

It's #NationalNonprofitDay, and we're celebrating with some Khan Academy trivia.🎉

Every employee that joins the Khan Academy team plays two truths and one lie at our all-company meeting. The team tries to guess the lie (and we're pretty good at it...😏). 

It's your turn to play two truths and one lie!

Which of these is a lie?🤔
A) Sal hired an agency to develop our mission statement
B) We've always been a nonprofit
C) Y'all spent 12.4 billion minutes learning on Khan Academy in 2020

UPDATE: The answer is A! Sal came up with the mission statement on his own while filling out the forms to incorporate Khan Academy as a 501c(3) nonprofit. We've always been a nonprofit and yall DID spend 12.4 BILLION minutes learning in 2020.😮🤩 Thanks for playing!

Comment your guess and check for the answer tomorrow!😁

Who is feeling a little nervous about school starting? 🙃

We know that every new school year comes with a lot of unknowns - new teachers, classmates, subjects, maybe a new school, being in person again or another year of remote?

Looking for some relief? 😌

Take a few minutes to spend with Sal Khan's voice in a guided meditation. 😁 Sal starts with breathing techniques and goes over how to relax, be curious, and go on an inward voyage of the mind.✨

Ready to join us? 🥺 Head to the link in our bio to get started.🔗
